description: Creates a new cluster with the specified parameters. To create a cluster in Virtual Private Cloud (VPC), you must provide a cluster subnet group name. The cluster subnet group identifies the subnets of your VPC that Amazon Redshift uses when creating the cluster. For more information about managing clusters, go to Amazon Redshift Clusters in the Amazon Redshift Cluster Management Guide. VPC Block Public Access (BPA) enables you to block resources in VPCs and subnets that you own in a Region from reaching or being reached from the internet through internet gateways and egress-only internet gateways. If a subnet group for a provisioned cluster is in an account with VPC BPA turned on, the following capabilities are blocked: For more information about VPC BPA, see Block public access to VPCs and subnets in the Amazon VPC User Guide.

parameters.name: DBName
parameters.description: The name of the first database to be created when the cluster is created. To create additional databases after the cluster is created, connect to the cluster with a SQL client and use SQL commands to create a database. For more information, go to Create a Database in the Amazon Redshift Database Developer Guide. Default: dev Constraints: Must contain 1 to 64 alphanumeric characters. Must contain only lowercase letters. Cannot be a word that is reserved by the service. A list of reserved words can be found in Reserved Words in the Amazon Redshift Database Developer Guide.

parameters.name: ClusterIdentifier
parameters.description: A unique identifier for the cluster. You use this identifier to refer to the cluster for any subsequent cluster operations such as deleting or modifying. The identifier also appears in the Amazon Redshift console. Constraints: Must contain from 1 to 63 alphanumeric characters or hyphens. Alphabetic characters must be lowercase. First character must be a letter. Cannot end with a hyphen or contain two consecutive hyphens. Must be unique for all clusters within an Amazon Web Services account. Example: myexamplecluster.

parameters.name: ClusterType
parameters.description: The type of the cluster. When cluster type is specified as single-node, the NumberOfNodes parameter is not required. multi-node, the NumberOfNodes parameter is required. Valid Values: multi-node | single-node Default: multi-node.

parameters.name: NodeType
parameters.description: The node type to be provisioned for the cluster. For information about node types, go to Working with Clusters in the Amazon Redshift Cluster Management Guide. Valid Values: dc2.large | dc2.8xlarge | ra3.large | ra3.xlplus | ra3.4xlarge | ra3.16xlarge.

parameters.name: MasterUsername
parameters.description: The user name associated with the admin user account for the cluster that is being created. Constraints: Must be 1 - 128 alphanumeric characters or hyphens. The user name can't be PUBLIC. Must contain only lowercase letters, numbers, underscore, plus sign, period (dot), at symbol (@), or hyphen. The first character must be a letter. Must not contain a colon (:) or a slash (/). Cannot be a reserved word. A list of reserved words can be found in Reserved Words in the Amazon Redshift Database Developer Guide.

parameters.name: MasterUserPassword
parameters.description: The password associated with the admin user account for the cluster that is being created. You can't use MasterUserPassword if ManageMasterPassword is true. Constraints: Must be between 8 and 64 characters in length. Must contain at least one uppercase letter. Must contain at least one lowercase letter. Must contain one number. Can be any printable ASCII character (ASCII code 33-126) except ' (single quote), " (double quote), \, /, or @.

parameters.name: ClusterSecurityGroups
parameters.description: A list of security groups to be associated with this cluster. Default: The default cluster security group for Amazon Redshift. (string) ---

parameters.name: VpcSecurityGroupIds
parameters.description: A list of Virtual Private Cloud (VPC) security groups to be associated with the cluster. Default: The default VPC security group is associated with the cluster. (string) ---

parameters.name: ClusterSubnetGroupName
parameters.description: The name of a cluster subnet group to be associated with this cluster. If this parameter is not provided the resulting cluster will be deployed outside virtual private cloud (VPC).

parameters.name: AvailabilityZone
parameters.description: The EC2 Availability Zone (AZ) in which you want Amazon Redshift to provision the cluster. For example, if you have several EC2 instances running in a specific Availability Zone, then you might want the cluster to be provisioned in the same zone in order to decrease network latency. Default: A random, system-chosen Availability Zone in the region that is specified by the endpoint. Example: us-east-2d Constraint: The specified Availability Zone must be in the same region as the current endpoint.

parameters.name: PreferredMaintenanceWindow
parameters.description: The weekly time range (in UTC) during which automated cluster maintenance can occur. Format: ddd:hh24:mi-ddd:hh24:mi Default: A 30-minute window selected at random from an 8-hour block of time per region, occurring on a random day of the week. For more information about the time blocks for each region, see Maintenance Windows in Amazon Redshift Cluster Management Guide. Valid Days: Mon | Tue | Wed | Thu | Fri | Sat | Sun Constraints: Minimum 30-minute window.

parameters.name: ClusterParameterGroupName
parameters.description: The name of the parameter group to be associated with this cluster. Default: The default Amazon Redshift cluster parameter group. For information about the default parameter group, go to Working with Amazon Redshift Parameter Groups Constraints: Must be 1 to 255 alphanumeric characters or hyphens. First character must be a letter. Cannot end with a hyphen or contain two consecutive hyphens.

parameters.name: AutomatedSnapshotRetentionPeriod
parameters.description: The number of days that automated snapshots are retained. If the value is 0, automated snapshots are disabled. Even if automated snapshots are disabled, you can still create manual snapshots when you want with  CreateClusterSnapshot. You can't disable automated snapshots for RA3 node types. Set the automated retention period from 1-35 days. Default: 1 Constraints: Must be a value from 0 to 35.

parameters.name: ManualSnapshotRetentionPeriod
parameters.description: The default number of days to retain a manual snapshot. If the value is -1, the snapshot is retained indefinitely. This setting doesn't change the retention period of existing snapshots. The value must be either -1 or an integer between 1 and 3,653.

parameters.name: Port
parameters.description: The port number on which the cluster accepts incoming connections. The cluster is accessible only via the JDBC and ODBC connection strings. Part of the connection string requires the port on which the cluster will listen for incoming connections. Default: 5439 Valid Values: For clusters with ra3 nodes - Select a port within the ranges 5431-5455 or 8191-8215. (If you have an existing cluster with ra3 nodes, it isn't required that you change the port to these ranges.) For clusters with dc2 nodes - Select a port within the range 1150-65535.

parameters.name: ClusterVersion
parameters.description: The version of the Amazon Redshift engine software that you want to deploy on the cluster. The version selected runs on all the nodes in the cluster. Constraints: Only version 1.0 is currently available. Example: 1.0

parameters.name: AllowVersionUpgrade
parameters.description: If true, major version upgrades can be applied during the maintenance window to the Amazon Redshift engine that is running on the cluster. When a new major version of the Amazon Redshift engine is released, you can request that the service automatically apply upgrades during the maintenance window to the Amazon Redshift engine that is running on your cluster. Default: true.

parameters.name: NumberOfNodes
parameters.description: The number of compute nodes in the cluster. This parameter is required when the ClusterType parameter is specified as multi-node. For information about determining how many nodes you need, go to Working with Clusters in the Amazon Redshift Cluster Management Guide. If you don't specify this parameter, you get a single-node cluster. When requesting a multi-node cluster, you must specify the number of nodes that you want in the cluster. Default: 1 Constraints: Value must be at least 1 and no more than 100.

parameters.name: PubliclyAccessible
parameters.description: If true, the cluster can be accessed from a public network. Default: false.

parameters.name: Encrypted
parameters.description: If true, the data in the cluster is encrypted at rest. If you set the value on this parameter to false, the request will fail. Default: true.

parameters.name: ElasticIp
parameters.description: The Elastic IP (EIP) address for the cluster. Constraints: The cluster must be provisioned in EC2-VPC and publicly-accessible through an Internet gateway. Don't specify the Elastic IP address for a publicly accessible cluster with availability zone relocation turned on. For more information about provisioning clusters in EC2-VPC, go to Supported Platforms to Launch Your Cluster in the Amazon Redshift Cluster Management Guide.

parameters.name: Tags
parameters.description: A list of tag instances. (dict) --- A tag consisting of a name/value pair for a resource. Key (string) --- The key, or name, for the resource tag. Value (string) --- The value for the resource tag.

nested_params.name: Key
nested_params.description: The key, or name, for the resource tag.

nested_params.name: Value
nested_params.description: The value for the resource tag.

parameters.name: EnhancedVpcRouting
parameters.description: An option that specifies whether to create the cluster with enhanced VPC routing enabled. To create a cluster that uses enhanced VPC routing, the cluster must be in a VPC. For more information, see Enhanced VPC Routing in the Amazon Redshift Cluster Management Guide. If this option is true, enhanced VPC routing is enabled. Default: false.

parameters.name: IamRoles
parameters.description: A list of Identity and Access Management (IAM) roles that can be used by the cluster to access other Amazon Web Services services. You must supply the IAM roles in their Amazon Resource Name (ARN) format. The maximum number of IAM roles that you can associate is subject to a quota. For more information, go to Quotas and limits in the Amazon Redshift Cluster Management Guide. (string) ---

nested_items.name: ClusterIdentifier
nested_items.description: The unique identifier of the cluster.

nested_items.name: NodeType
nested_items.description: The node type for the nodes in the cluster.

nested_items.name: ClusterStatus
nested_items.description: The current state of the cluster. Possible values are the following:
available.
available, prep-for-resize.
available, resize-cleanup.
cancelling-resize.
creating.
deleting.
final-snapshot.
hardware-failure.
incompatible-hsm.
incompatible-network.
incompatible-parameters.
incompatible-restore.
modifying.
paused.
rebooting.
renaming.
resizing.
rotating-keys.
storage-full.
updating-hsm.

nested_items.name: ClusterAvailabilityStatus
nested_items.description: The availability status of the cluster for queries. Possible values are the following:
Available - The cluster is available for queries.
Unavailable - The cluster is not available for queries.
Maintenance - The cluster is intermittently available for queries due to maintenance activities.
Modifying - The cluster is intermittently available for queries due to changes that modify the cluster.
Failed - The cluster failed and is not available for queries.

nested_items.name: ModifyStatus
nested_items.description: The status of a modify operation, if any, initiated for the cluster.

nested_items.name: MasterUsername
nested_items.description: The admin user name for the cluster. This name is used to connect to the database that is specified in the DBName parameter.

nested_items.name: DBName
nested_items.description: The name of the initial database that was created when the cluster was created. This same name is returned for the life of the cluster. If an initial database was not specified, a database named ``dev``dev was created by default.

nested_items.name: Address
nested_items.description: The DNS address of the Cluster.

nested_items.name: Port
nested_items.description: The port that the database engine is listening on.

nested_items.name: VpcEndpoints
nested_items.description: Describes a connection endpoint.

nested_items.name: VpcEndpointId
nested_items.description: The connection endpoint ID for connecting an Amazon Redshift cluster through the proxy.

nested_items.name: VpcId
nested_items.description: The VPC identifier that the endpoint is associated.

nested_items.name: NetworkInterfaces
nested_items.description: One or more network interfaces of the endpoint. Also known as an interface endpoint.

nested_items.name: NetworkInterfaceId
nested_items.description: The network interface identifier.

nested_items.name: SubnetId
nested_items.description: The subnet identifier.

nested_items.name: PrivateIpAddress
nested_items.description: The IPv4 address of the network interface within the subnet.

nested_items.name: AvailabilityZone
nested_items.description: The Availability Zone.

nested_items.name: Ipv6Address
nested_items.description: The IPv6 address of the network interface within the subnet.

nested_items.name: ClusterCreateTime
nested_items.description: The date and time that the cluster was created.

nested_items.name: AutomatedSnapshotRetentionPeriod
nested_items.description: The number of days that automatic cluster snapshots are retained.

nested_items.name: ManualSnapshotRetentionPeriod
nested_items.description: The default number of days to retain a manual snapshot. If the value is -1, the snapshot is retained indefinitely. This setting doesn't change the retention period of existing snapshots.

nested_items.name: ClusterSecurityGroups
nested_items.description: A list of cluster security group that are associated with the cluster. Each security group is represented by an element that contains ClusterSecurityGroup.Name and ClusterSecurityGroup.Status subelements.

nested_items.name: ClusterSecurityGroupName
nested_items.description: The name of the cluster security group.

nested_items.name: Status
nested_items.description: The status of the cluster security group.

nested_items.name: VpcSecurityGroups
nested_items.description: A list of Amazon Virtual Private Cloud (Amazon VPC) security groups that are associated with the cluster. This parameter is returned only if the cluster is in a VPC.

nested_items.name: VpcSecurityGroupId
nested_items.description: The identifier of the VPC security group.

nested_items.name: Status
nested_items.description: The status of the VPC security group.

nested_items.name: ClusterParameterGroups
nested_items.description: The list of cluster parameter groups that are associated with this cluster. Each parameter group in the list is returned with its status.

nested_items.name: ParameterGroupName
nested_items.description: The name of the cluster parameter group.

nested_items.name: ParameterApplyStatus
nested_items.description: The status of parameter updates.

nested_items.name: ClusterParameterStatusList
nested_items.description: The list of parameter statuses.

nested_items.name: ParameterName
nested_items.description: The name of the parameter.

nested_items.name: ParameterApplyStatus
nested_items.description: The status of the parameter that indicates whether the parameter is in sync with the database, waiting for a cluster reboot, or encountered an error when being applied.
in-sync: The parameter value is in sync with the database.
pending-reboot: The parameter value will be applied after the cluster reboots.
applying: The parameter value is being applied to the database.
invalid-parameter: Cannot apply the parameter value because it has an invalid value or syntax.
apply-deferred: The parameter contains static property changes. The changes are deferred until the cluster reboots.
apply-error: Cannot connect to the cluster. The parameter change will be applied after the cluster reboots.
unknown-error: Cannot apply the parameter change right now. The change will be applied after the cluster reboots.

nested_items.name: ParameterApplyErrorDescription
nested_items.description: The error that prevented the parameter from being applied to the database.

nested_items.name: ClusterSubnetGroupName
nested_items.description: The name of the subnet group that is associated with the cluster. This parameter is valid only when the cluster is in a VPC.

nested_items.name: VpcId
nested_items.description: The identifier of the VPC the cluster is in, if the cluster is in a VPC.

nested_items.name: AvailabilityZone
nested_items.description: The name of the Availability Zone in which the cluster is located.

nested_items.name: PreferredMaintenanceWindow
nested_items.description: The weekly time range, in Universal Coordinated Time (UTC), during which system maintenance can occur.

nested_items.name: PendingModifiedValues
nested_items.description: A value that, if present, indicates that changes to the cluster are pending. Specific pending changes are identified by subelements.

nested_items.name: MasterUserPassword
nested_items.description: The pending or in-progress change of the admin user password for the cluster.

nested_items.name: NodeType
nested_items.description: The pending or in-progress change of the cluster's node type.

nested_items.name: NumberOfNodes
nested_items.description: The pending or in-progress change of the number of nodes in the cluster.

nested_items.name: ClusterType
nested_items.description: The pending or in-progress change of the cluster type.

nested_items.name: ClusterVersion
nested_items.description: The pending or in-progress change of the service version.

nested_items.name: AutomatedSnapshotRetentionPeriod
nested_items.description: The pending or in-progress change of the automated snapshot retention period.

nested_items.name: ClusterIdentifier
nested_items.description: The pending or in-progress change of the new identifier for the cluster.

nested_items.name: PubliclyAccessible
nested_items.description: The pending or in-progress change of the ability to connect to the cluster from the public network.

nested_items.name: EnhancedVpcRouting
nested_items.description: An option that specifies whether to create the cluster with enhanced VPC routing enabled. To create a cluster that uses enhanced VPC routing, the cluster must be in a VPC. For more information, see Enhanced VPC Routing in the Amazon Redshift Cluster Management Guide.

nested_items.name: MaintenanceTrackName
nested_items.description: The name of the maintenance track that the cluster will change to during the next maintenance window.

nested_items.name: EncryptionType
nested_items.description: The encryption type for a cluster. Possible values are: KMS and None.

nested_items.name: ClusterVersion
nested_items.description: The version ID of the Amazon Redshift engine that is running on the cluster.

nested_items.name: AllowVersionUpgrade
nested_items.description: A boolean value that, if true, indicates that major version upgrades will be applied automatically to the cluster during the maintenance window.

nested_items.name: NumberOfNodes
nested_items.description: The number of compute nodes in the cluster.

nested_items.name: PubliclyAccessible
nested_items.description: A boolean value that, if true, indicates that the cluster can be accessed from a public network.

nested_items.name: Encrypted
nested_items.description: A boolean value that, if true, indicates that data in the cluster is encrypted at rest.

nested_items.name: RestoreStatus
nested_items.description: A value that describes the status of a cluster restore action. This parameter returns null if the cluster was not created by restoring a snapshot.

nested_items.name: Status
nested_items.description: The status of the restore action. Returns starting, restoring, completed, or failed.

nested_items.name: CurrentRestoreRateInMegaBytesPerSecond
nested_items.description: The number of megabytes per second being transferred from the backup storage. Returns the average rate for a completed backup. This field is only updated when you restore to DC2 node types.

nested_items.name: SnapshotSizeInMegaBytes
nested_items.description: The size of the set of snapshot data used to restore the cluster. This field is only updated when you restore to DC2 node types.

nested_items.name: ProgressInMegaBytes
nested_items.description: The number of megabytes that have been transferred from snapshot storage. This field is only updated when you restore to DC2 node types.

nested_items.name: ElapsedTimeInSeconds
nested_items.description: The amount of time an in-progress restore has been running, or the amount of time it took a completed restore to finish. This field is only updated when you restore to DC2 node types.

nested_items.name: EstimatedTimeToCompletionInSeconds
nested_items.description: The estimate of the time remaining before the restore will complete. Returns 0 for a completed restore. This field is only updated when you restore to DC2 node types.

nested_items.name: Status
nested_items.description: Describes the status of the cluster. While the transfer is in progress the status is transferringdata.

nested_items.name: CurrentRateInMegaBytesPerSecond
nested_items.description: Describes the data transfer rate in MB's per second.

nested_items.name: TotalDataInMegaBytes
nested_items.description: Describes the total amount of data to be transfered in megabytes.

nested_items.name: DataTransferredInMegaBytes
nested_items.description: Describes the total amount of data that has been transfered in MB's.

nested_items.name: EstimatedTimeToCompletionInSeconds
nested_items.description: Describes the estimated number of seconds remaining to complete the transfer.

nested_items.name: ElapsedTimeInSeconds
nested_items.description: Describes the number of seconds that have elapsed during the data transfer.

nested_items.name: HsmStatus
nested_items.description: A value that reports whether the Amazon Redshift cluster has finished applying any hardware security module (HSM) settings changes specified in a modify cluster command.

nested_items.name: HsmClientCertificateIdentifier
nested_items.description: Specifies the name of the HSM client certificate the Amazon Redshift cluster uses to retrieve the data encryption keys stored in an HSM.

nested_items.name: HsmConfigurationIdentifier
nested_items.description: Specifies the name of the HSM configuration that contains the information the Amazon Redshift cluster can use to retrieve and store keys in an HSM.

nested_items.name: Status
nested_items.description: Reports whether the Amazon Redshift cluster has finished applying any HSM settings changes specified in a modify cluster command.

nested_items.name: ClusterSnapshotCopyStatus
nested_items.description: A value that returns the destination region and retention period that are configured for cross-region snapshot copy.

nested_items.name: DestinationRegion
nested_items.description: The destination region that snapshots are automatically copied to when cross-region snapshot copy is enabled.

nested_items.name: RetentionPeriod
nested_items.description: The number of days that automated snapshots are retained in the destination region after they are copied from a source region.

nested_items.name: ManualSnapshotRetentionPeriod
nested_items.description: The number of days that automated snapshots are retained in the destination region after they are copied from a source region. If the value is -1, the manual snapshot is retained indefinitely.

nested_items.name: SnapshotCopyGrantName
nested_items.description: The name of the snapshot copy grant.

nested_items.name: ClusterPublicKey
nested_items.description: The public key for the cluster.

nested_items.name: ClusterNodes
nested_items.description: The nodes in the cluster.

nested_items.name: NodeRole
nested_items.description: Whether the node is a leader node or a compute node.

nested_items.name: PrivateIPAddress
nested_items.description: The private IP address of a node within a cluster.

nested_items.name: PublicIPAddress
nested_items.description: The public IP address of a node within a cluster.

nested_items.name: ElasticIpStatus
nested_items.description: The status of the elastic IP (EIP) address.

nested_items.name: ElasticIp
nested_items.description: The elastic IP (EIP) address for the cluster.

nested_items.name: Status
nested_items.description: The status of the elastic IP (EIP) address.

nested_items.name: ClusterRevisionNumber
nested_items.description: The specific revision number of the database in the cluster.

nested_items.name: Tags
nested_items.description: The list of tags for the cluster.

nested_items.name: Key
nested_items.description: The key, or name, for the resource tag.

nested_items.name: Value
nested_items.description: The value for the resource tag.

nested_items.name: KmsKeyId
nested_items.description: The Key Management Service (KMS) key ID of the encryption key used to encrypt data in the cluster.

nested_items.name: EnhancedVpcRouting
nested_items.description: An option that specifies whether to create the cluster with enhanced VPC routing enabled. To create a cluster that uses enhanced VPC routing, the cluster must be in a VPC. For more information, see Enhanced VPC Routing in the Amazon Redshift Cluster Management Guide.

nested_items.name: IamRoles
nested_items.description: A list of Identity and Access Management (IAM) roles that can be used by the cluster to access other Amazon Web Services services.

nested_items.name: IamRoleArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role, for example, arn:aws:iam::123456789012:role/RedshiftCopyUnload.

nested_items.name: ApplyStatus
nested_items.description: A value that describes the status of the IAM role's association with an Amazon Redshift cluster.
in-sync: The role is available for use by the cluster.
adding: The role is in the process of being associated with the cluster.
removing: The role is in the process of being disassociated with the cluster.

nested_items.name: PendingActions
nested_items.description: Cluster operations that are waiting to be started.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: MaintenanceTrackName
nested_items.description: The name of the maintenance track for the cluster.

nested_items.name: ElasticResizeNumberOfNodeOptions
nested_items.description: The number of nodes that you can resize the cluster to with the elastic resize method.

nested_items.name: DeferredMaintenanceWindows
nested_items.description: Describes a group of DeferredMaintenanceWindow objects.

nested_items.name: DeferMaintenanceIdentifier
nested_items.description: A unique identifier for the maintenance window.

nested_items.name: DeferMaintenanceStartTime
nested_items.description: A timestamp for the beginning of the time period when we defer maintenance.

nested_items.name: DeferMaintenanceEndTime
nested_items.description: A timestamp for the end of the time period when we defer maintenance.

nested_items.name: SnapshotScheduleIdentifier
nested_items.description: A unique identifier for the cluster snapshot schedule.

nested_items.name: SnapshotScheduleState
nested_items.description: The current state of the cluster snapshot schedule.

nested_items.name: ExpectedNextSnapshotScheduleTime
nested_items.description: The date and time when the next snapshot is expected to be taken for clusters with a valid snapshot schedule and backups enabled.

nested_items.name: ExpectedNextSnapshotScheduleTimeStatus
nested_items.description: The status of next expected snapshot for clusters having a valid snapshot schedule and backups enabled. Possible values are the following:
OnTrack - The next snapshot is expected to be taken on time.
Pending - The next snapshot is pending to be taken.

nested_items.name: NextMaintenanceWindowStartTime
nested_items.description: The date and time in UTC when system maintenance can begin.

nested_items.name: ResizeInfo
nested_items.description: Returns the following:
AllowCancelResize: a boolean value indicating if the resize operation can be cancelled.
ResizeType: Returns ClassicResize.

nested_items.name: AvailabilityZoneRelocationStatus
nested_items.description: Describes the status of the Availability Zone relocation operation.

nested_items.name: ClusterNamespaceArn
nested_items.description: The namespace Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the cluster.

nested_items.name: TotalStorageCapacityInMegaBytes
nested_items.description: The total storage capacity of the cluster in megabytes.

nested_items.name: AquaConfiguration
nested_items.description: This field is retired. Amazon Redshift automatically determines whether to use AQUA (Advanced Query Accelerator).

nested_items.name: AquaStatus
nested_items.description: This field is retired. Amazon Redshift automatically determines whether to use AQUA (Advanced Query Accelerator).

nested_items.name: AquaConfigurationStatus
nested_items.description: This field is retired. Amazon Redshift automatically determines whether to use AQUA (Advanced Query Accelerator).

nested_items.name: DefaultIamRoleArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the IAM role set as default for the cluster.

nested_items.name: ReservedNodeExchangeStatus
nested_items.description: The status of the reserved-node exchange request. Statuses include in-progress and requested.

nested_items.name: ReservedNodeExchangeRequestId
nested_items.description: The identifier of the reserved-node exchange request.

nested_items.name: Status
nested_items.description: The status of the reserved-node exchange request. Statuses include in-progress and requested.

nested_items.name: RequestTime
nested_items.description: A date and time that indicate when the reserved-node exchange was requested.

nested_items.name: SourceReservedNodeId
nested_items.description: The identifier of the source reserved node.

nested_items.name: SourceReservedNodeType
nested_items.description: The source reserved-node type, for example ra3.4xlarge.

nested_items.name: SourceReservedNodeCount
nested_items.description: The source reserved-node count in the cluster.

nested_items.name: TargetReservedNodeOfferingId
nested_items.description: The identifier of the target reserved node offering.

nested_items.name: TargetReservedNodeType
nested_items.description: The node type of the target reserved node, for example ra3.4xlarge.

nested_items.name: TargetReservedNodeCount
nested_items.description: The count of target reserved nodes in the cluster.

nested_items.name: CustomDomainName
nested_items.description: The custom domain name associated with the cluster.

nested_items.name: CustomDomainCertificateArn
nested_items.description: The certificate Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the custom domain name.

nested_items.name: CustomDomainCertificateExpiryDate
nested_items.description: The expiration date for the certificate associated with the custom domain name.

nested_items.name: MasterPasswordSecretArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the cluster's admin user credentials secret.

nested_items.name: MasterPasswordSecretKmsKeyId
nested_items.description: The ID of the Key Management Service (KMS) key used to encrypt and store the cluster's admin credentials secret.

nested_items.name: IpAddressType
nested_items.description: The IP address type for the cluster. Possible values are ipv4 and dualstack.

nested_items.name: MultiAZ
nested_items.description: A boolean value that, if true, indicates that the cluster is deployed in two Availability Zones.

nested_items.name: MultiAZSecondary
nested_items.description: The secondary compute unit of a cluster, if Multi-AZ deployment is turned on.

nested_items.name: AvailabilityZone
nested_items.description: The name of the Availability Zone in which the secondary compute unit of the cluster is located.

nested_items.name: ClusterNodes
nested_items.description: The nodes in the secondary compute unit.

nested_items.name: NodeRole
nested_items.description: Whether the node is a leader node or a compute node.

nested_items.name: PrivateIPAddress
nested_items.description: The private IP address of a node within a cluster.

nested_items.name: PublicIPAddress
nested_items.description: The public IP address of a node within a cluster.
